MediaGraphInstanceProperties.title: Instance properties
MediaGraphInstanceProperties.description: Properties of a Media Graph instance.

MediaGraphInstanceProperties.description.title: Description
MediaGraphInstanceProperties.description.description: An optional description for the instance.

MediaGraphInstanceProperties.topologyNam.title: Topology name
MediaGraphInstanceProperties.topologyNam.description: The name of the graph topology that this instance will run. A topology with this name should already have been set in the Edge module.

MediaGraphInstanceProperties.parameters.title: Parameters
MediaGraphInstanceProperties.parameters.description: List of one or more graph instance parameters.

MediaGraphInstanceProperties.state.title: State
MediaGraphInstanceProperties.state.description: Allowed states for a graph Instance.

MediaGraphParameterDefinition.title: Parameter definition
MediaGraphParameterDefinition.description: A key, value pair. The graph topology can be authored with certain values with parameters. Then, during graph instance creation, the value for that parameters can be specified. This allows the same graph topology to be used as a blueprint for multiple graph instances with different values for the parameters.

MediaGraphParameterDefinition.name.title: Name
MediaGraphParameterDefinition.name.description: Name of parameter as defined in the graph topology.

MediaGraphInstanceCollection.@continuati.title: @continuation token
MediaGraphInstanceCollection.@continuati.description: Continuation token to use in subsequent calls to enumerate through the graph instance collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).

MediaGraphTopologyCollection.@continuati.title: @continuation token
MediaGraphTopologyCollection.@continuati.description: Continuation token to use in subsequent calls to enumerate through the graph topologies collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).

MediaGraphTopologyProperties.title: Topology properties
MediaGraphTopologyProperties.description: Describes the properties of a graph topology.

MediaGraphSystemData.lastModifiedAt.title: Last modified at
MediaGraphSystemData.lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC).

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.title: Parameter declaration
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.description: The declaration of a parameter in the graph topology. A graph topology can be authored with parameters. Then, during graph instance creation, the value for those parameters can be specified. This allows the same graph topology to be used as a blueprint for multiple graph instances with different values for the parameters.

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Secr.title: Secret string
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Secr.description: A string to hold sensitive information as parameter value.

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Int.title: Int
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Int.description: A 32-bit signed integer as parameter value.

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Doub.title: Double
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Doub.description: A 64-bit double-precision floating point type as parameter value.

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Bool.title: Bool
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.type.Bool.description: A boolean value that is either true or false.

MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.default.title: Default
MediaGraphParameterDeclaration.default.description: The default value for the parameter, to be used if the graph instance does not specify a value.

MediaGraphSource.@type.title: @type
MediaGraphSource.@type.description: The type of the source node. The discriminator for derived types.

MediaGraphSource.name.title: Name
MediaGraphSource.name.description: The name to be used for this source node.

MediaGraphRtspSource.title: RTSP source
MediaGraphRtspSource.description: Enables a graph to capture media from a RTSP server.

MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.title: Transport
MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.description: Underlying RTSP transport. This is used to enable or disable HTTP tunneling.

MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.Http.title: HTTP
MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.Http.description: HTTP/HTTPS transport. This should be used when HTTP tunneling is desired.

MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.Tcp.title: TCP
MediaGraphRtspSource.transport.Tcp.description: TCP transport. This should be used when HTTP tunneling is NOT desired.

MediaGraphRtspSource.endpoint.title: Endpoint
MediaGraphRtspSource.endpoint.description: RTSP endpoint of the stream that is being connected to.

MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSource.title: IoT hub message source
MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSource.description: Enables a graph to receive messages via routes declared in the IoT Edge deployment manifest.

MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSource.hubInputNa.title: Hub input name
MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSource.hubInputNa.description: Name of the input path where messages can be routed to (via routes declared in the IoT Edge deployment manifest).

MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSink.title: IoT hub message sink
MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSink.description: Enables a graph to publish messages that can be delivered via routes declared in the IoT Edge deployment manifest.

MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSink.hubOutputNam.title: Hub output name
MediaGraphIoTHubMessageSink.hubOutputNam.description: Name of the output path to which the graph will publish message. These messages can then be delivered to desired destinations by declaring routes referencing the output path in the IoT Edge deployment manifest.

MediaGraphEndpoint.credentials.title: Credentials
MediaGraphEndpoint.credentials.description: Polymorphic credentials to be presented to the endpoint.

MediaGraphUnsecuredEndpoint.title: Unsecured endpoint
MediaGraphUnsecuredEndpoint.description: An endpoint that the media graph can connect to, with no encryption in transit.

MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.title: TLS endpoint
MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.description: An endpoint that the graph can connect to, which must be connected over TLS/SSL.

MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.trustedCertificate.title: Trusted certificates
MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.trustedCertificate.description: Trusted certificates when authenticating a TLS connection. Null designates that Azure Media Service's source of trust should be used.

MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.validationOptions.title: Validation options
MediaGraphTlsEndpoint.validationOptions.description: Validation options to use when authenticating a TLS connection. By default, strict validation is used.

MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.title: TLS validation options
MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.description: Options for controlling the authentication of TLS endpoints.

MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.ignoreHos.title: Ignore hostname
MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.ignoreHos.description: Boolean value ignoring the host name (common name) during validation.

MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.ignoreSig.title: Ignore signature
MediaGraphTlsValidationOptions.ignoreSig.description: Boolean value ignoring the integrity of the certificate chain at the current time.

MediaGraphPemCertificateList.title: PEM certificate list
MediaGraphPemCertificateList.description: A list of PEM formatted certificates.

MediaGraphPemCertificateList.certificate.title: Certificates
MediaGraphPemCertificateList.certificate.description: PEM formatted public certificates one per entry.

MediaGraphSink.title: Sink
MediaGraphSink.description: Enables a media graph to write media data to a destination outside of the Live Video Analytics IoT Edge module.

MediaGraphSink.name.title: Name
MediaGraphSink.name.description: Name to be used for the media graph sink.

MediaGraphSink.inputs.title: Inputs
MediaGraphSink.inputs.description: An array of the names of the other nodes in the media graph, the outputs of which are used as input for this sink node.

MediaGraphNodeInput.title: Node input
MediaGraphNodeInput.description: Represents the input to any node in a media graph.

MediaGraphNodeInput.nodeName.title: Node name
MediaGraphNodeInput.nodeName.description: The name of another node in the media graph, the output of which is used as input to this node.

MediaGraphNodeInput.outputSelectors.title: Output selectors
MediaGraphNodeInput.outputSelectors.description: Allows for the selection of particular streams from another node.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.title: Output selector
MediaGraphOutputSelector.description: Allows for the selection of particular streams from another node.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.property.title: Property
MediaGraphOutputSelector.property.description: The stream property to compare with.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.property.mediaT.title: Media type
MediaGraphOutputSelector.property.mediaT.description: The stream's MIME type or subtype.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.title: Operator
MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.description: The operator to compare streams by.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.is.title: Is
MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.is.description: A media type is the same type or a subtype.

MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.isNot.title: Is not
MediaGraphOutputSelector.operator.isNot.description: A media type is not the same type or a subtype.

MediaGraphFileSink.title: File sink
MediaGraphFileSink.description: Enables a media graph to write/store media (video and audio) to a file on the Edge device.

MediaGraphFileSink.filePathPattern.title: File path pattern
MediaGraphFileSink.filePathPattern.description: Absolute file path pattern for creating new files on the Edge device.

MediaGraphAssetSink.title: Asset sink
MediaGraphAssetSink.description: Enables a graph to record media to an Azure Media Services asset, for subsequent playback.

MediaGraphAssetSink.assetNamePattern.title: Asset name pattern
MediaGraphAssetSink.assetNamePattern.description: A name pattern when creating new assets.

MediaGraphAssetSink.segmentLength.title: Segment length
MediaGraphAssetSink.segmentLength.description: When writing media to an asset, wait until at least this duration of media has been accumulated on the Edge. Expressed in increments of 30 seconds, with a minimum of 30 seconds and a recommended maximum of 5 minutes.

MediaGraphAssetSink.localMediaCachePath.title: Local media cache path
MediaGraphAssetSink.localMediaCachePath.description: Path to a local file system directory for temporary caching of media, before writing to an Asset. Used when the Edge device is temporarily disconnected from Azure.

MediaGraphAssetSink.localMediaCacheMaxim.title: Local media cache maximum size mi b
MediaGraphAssetSink.localMediaCacheMaxim.description: Maximum amount of disk space that can be used for temporary caching of media.

MediaGraphProcessor.title: Processor
MediaGraphProcessor.description: A node that represents the desired processing of media in a graph. Takes media and/or events as inputs, and emits media and/or event as output.

MediaGraphProcessor.name.title: Name
MediaGraphProcessor.name.description: The name for this processor node.

MediaGraphProcessor.inputs.title: Inputs
MediaGraphProcessor.inputs.description: An array of the names of the other nodes in the media graph, the outputs of which are used as input for this processor node.

MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.title: Motion detection processor
MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.description: A node that accepts raw video as input, and detects if there are moving objects present. If so, then it emits an event, and allows frames where motion was detected to pass through. Other frames are blocked/dropped.

MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.sensi.title: Sensitivity
MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.sensi.description: Enumeration that specifies the sensitivity of the motion detection processor.

MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.outpu.title: Output motion region
MediaGraphMotionDetectionProcessor.outpu.description: Indicates whether the processor should detect and output the regions, within the video frame, where motion was detected. Default is true.

MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.title: Extension processor base
MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.description: Processor that allows for extensions, outside of the Live Video Analytics Edge module, to be integrated into the graph. It is the base class for various different kinds of extension processor types.

MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.endpoin.title: Endpoint
MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.endpoin.description: Endpoint to which this processor should connect.

MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.image.title: Image
MediaGraphExtensionProcessorBase.image.description: Describes the parameters of the image that is sent as input to the endpoint.

MediaGraphHttpExtension.title: HTTP extension
MediaGraphHttpExtension.description: A processor that allows the media graph to send video frames (mostly at low frame rates e.g. <5 fps) to external inference container by leveraging HTTP based RESTful API. It then retrieves the inference results and relays them downstream to the next node.

MediaGraphImage.title: Image
MediaGraphImage.description: Describes the properties of an image frame.

MediaGraphImageScale.title: Image scale
MediaGraphImageScale.description: The scaling mode for the image.

MediaGraphImageScale.mode.title: Mode
MediaGraphImageScale.mode.description: Describes the modes for scaling an input video frame into an image, before it is sent to an inference engine.

MediaGraphImageScale.mode.PreserveAspect.title: Preserve aspect ratio
MediaGraphImageScale.mode.PreserveAspect.description: Use the same aspect ratio as the input frame.

MediaGraphImageScale.mode.Pad.title: Pad
MediaGraphImageScale.mode.Pad.description: Center pad the input frame to match the given dimensions.

MediaGraphImageScale.mode.Stretch.title: Stretch
MediaGraphImageScale.mode.Stretch.description: Stretch input frame to match given dimensions.

MediaGraphImageScale.width.title: Width
MediaGraphImageScale.width.description: The desired output width of the image.

MediaGraphImageScale.height.title: Height
MediaGraphImageScale.height.description: The desired output height of the image.

MediaGraphImageFormatRaw.pixelFormat.Yuv.title: YUV 420p
MediaGraphImageFormatRaw.pixelFormat.Yuv.description: Planar YUV 4:2:0, 12bpp, (1 Cr and Cb sample per 2x2 Y samples).

MediaGraphImageFormatEncoded.encoding.title: Encoding
MediaGraphImageFormatEncoded.encoding.description: The different encoding formats that can be used for the image.

MediaGraphImageFormatEncoded.quality.title: Quality
MediaGraphImageFormatEncoded.quality.description: The image quality (used for JPEG only). Value must be between 0 to 100 (best quality).

MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.title: Signal gate processor
MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.description: A signal gate determines when to block (gate) incoming media, and when to allow it through. It gathers input events over the activationEvaluationWindow, and determines whether to open or close the gate.

MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.activation.title: Activation evaluation window
MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.activation.description: The period of time over which the gate gathers input events, before evaluating them.

MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.activation.title: Activation signal offset
MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.activation.description: Signal offset once the gate is activated (can be negative). It is an offset between the time the event is received, and the timestamp of the first media sample (eg. video frame) that is allowed through by the gate.

MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.minimumAct.title: Minimum activation time
MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.minimumAct.description: The minimum period for which the gate remains open, in the absence of subsequent triggers (events).

MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.maximumAct.title: Maximum activation time
MediaGraphSignalGateProcessor.maximumAct.description: The maximum period for which the gate remains open, in the presence of subsequent events.

MediaGraphFrameRateFilterProcessor.title: Frame rate filter processor
MediaGraphFrameRateFilterProcessor.description: Limits the frame rate on the input video stream based on the maximumFps property.

MediaGraphFrameRateFilterProcessor.maxim.title: Maximum FPS
MediaGraphFrameRateFilterProcessor.maxim.description: Ensures that the frame rate of the video leaving this processor does not exceed this limit.
